etymologies: late 15th century (originally used of sight, in the sense ‘accurate, unerring’): from medieval Latin intuitivus, from Latin intueri (see intuit)

definitions: using or based on what one feels to be true even without conscious reasoning; instinctive

examples.text: I had an intuitive conviction that there was something unsound in him

shortDefinitions: using or based on what one feels to be true even without conscious reasoning

definitions: (chiefly of computer software) easy to use and understand.
shortDefinitions: (chiefly of computer software) easy to use and understand
